intro: Tetrapterys jamesonii var. granatensis, commonly known as the granate tetrapterys, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or white. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
